comments.author: Trint
comments.body:
Woohoo, first post!

Always like to see evidence of real progress.

comments.author: whitty
comments.body: Phew!  Scarlett Johansen's ass is slowly making it off the main page.  I was getting tired of looking at it.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Take that BACK.

comments.author: nicholas
comments.body:
yeah Dan, just to be PC...why not throw whitty a bone and find a shot of Colin Farrell's ass?

whoah...I just realized that the three of us could have had a similar conversation in a classroom 12 years ago...

I once poured sardines on whitty's head...

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: 12 years ago?! I was still wearing diapers 12 years ago! :0

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
I once wrote about nicholas pouring sardines on whitty's head.

I'm awesome.

comments.author: nicholas
comments.body: Hey, are the phlog photos originally mega-pixel images? Because I'm truly serious about getting you a book deal--high res photos could help the pitch...

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Nate: I'm the only person who's allowed to be awesome on this blog.

Nicholas: Yes, they're originally quite huge. Stunningly huge, actually.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
I will tone down my awesomeness when nearby.

I will need to make up for it with EXTRA AWESOMENESS everywhere else!

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Dan, did you see the article in Saturday's paper regarding Drury architectural students' project to build a market pavilion up on Commercial Street?
City officials expedited the approval process in a matter of days and were quoted something along the lines of "We'll help out people wherever we can to get their projects off the ground."

Thought you might find that interesting.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Here's the link
(Sorry - I'm HTMiLiterate and can't do links.)

http://springfield.news-leader.com/news/today/20050423-ClasscreatesCom.html

I laughed when I read it. You probably wont.

comments.body: Nate's article link

comments.body: Dammit Dan...nonresizable window...don't click that last link, click this one

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: I am shamed.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: DO I need to set up a special section for link submissions? Nate is shamed.

comments.author: nicholas
comments.body: it all depends on how easy you want to make it for people to post links. possibly to naked pictures of me in questionable poses...

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Aren't YOU supposed to be getting this thing up and running?

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: I'm awesome.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: No, seriously, Dan - don't you have some comment about the article?  I am curious if this throws you into a blind fit of rage or if you have reached a level of Zen.  Personally, I'd go for rage.  You are very funny enraged.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: The article was thoroughly enraging.

comments.author: nicholas
comments.body: Well, to be fair, the Pavillion is a new building and doesn't need to be brought up to code, etc. It still sounds like the wheels were greased though...

comments.author: Nicki J
comments.body:
A friend and I walked by the Moxie a while back, but you weren't there.

I just thought I'd throw that in. I was heartbroken that I didn't get to meet the infamous Dan. I still cry myself to sleep.

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: Recently I've found my self telling friends how awesome I am. I've picked that up SOLELY from reading this blog. That scares me slightly.

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: Sorry, telling them how AWESOME I am.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Nicki J: I'm there off and on, but starting tomorrow, I'll be there nearly every single night.

Fyse: I'm AWESOME!
